website_summaries.verdict: An extremely affordable option, perfect for mid-level jobs and home use. Hands down the best value for the money.
pros: Convenient tool-free blade changing and pivoting shoe
Great maximum speed w/variable trigger for control
cons: While lightweight construction is great for portability, it can also increase vibration

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS! BATTERY SOLD SEPARATELY!
customer_reviews.text: Would have been really helpful to know this is ONLY THE TOOL!!! It does not include the battery and charger! Description notes the battery and voltage, etc. so I assumed that was included. Buried in the specifications, it says "bare-tool" which apparently means just the saw, not the components to make it work. You'll pay another $60 or more for the battery and charger separately... or you can spend $35 and get a Cordless 20v Drill/Driver with battery and charger included, which is what I would recommend. I hope it's a solid tool, but won't know for a few days until my new drill with battery and charger arrives. FML.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Saws-it-ALL, then finds more to saw.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power with minimal video action, compared to the others on the market. I bought one for my 70 yr old active mom, because the vibration is minimal, after using countless times, I went and bought me one. This thing won't quit. I have tore down 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, and a 2,400 sqft wood shop with this, and still feels and acts like the day I bought it. I shopped for weeks going to store and looking on line, this was by far the best price I could find. Now the down side: I wish it would've came with a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dwakka

customer_reviews.title: I needed something lighter than other battery powered recip saws ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed something lighter than other battery powered recip saws for work in the garden. My hands and strength are failing me. This is ideal for removing branches too large for loppers. Obviously the blade is too small for anything much larger than 2 inches, but just right for about 90% of my needs. Battery lasts longer than I do, maybe an hour of off and on use. Also have the 20V Max Lithium grass trimmer. Keeps me in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: EleniMou

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases ever!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that could cut thick branches on trees and in bushes. I contemplated buying one of those pole saws that convert to chain saws, but most people I know who have one say they leak oil badly. Plus, I didn't really have room in the garage for an 8 ft tool. Since I already have two black and decker 20 volt batteries from my string trimmer, I decided to give this a chance. I purchased blades specifically for cutting branches of wood. I can honestly say that this is one of the two best purchases I have ever made on Amazon or anywhere. I love using it. Powerful, portable, convenient, just plain gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: dawgalum75

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of the Black and Decker battery driven tools. I am very pleased with all of them. Their batteries can be used on all the tools, which works out very well. This sawzall is my new favorite. It jumps right into whatever task I have. Recently it cut soil-covered roots of a lilac shrub that I was removing. How many tools can do that?! It is perfect for women gardeners. It cuts branches and such that were too big for the loppers but too small for my Black and Decker chainsaw. I recommend all these battery-driven Black and Decker tools for women, as they are lighter weight, well designed, not over-powered, reliable.
customer_reviews.author: NYC gal

customer_reviews.title: Nicely surprised
customer_reviews.text: Got this to go after large tree and shrub branches. Was a little worried about 20V battery life. It went through numerous large branches on 3 trees, getting them into small enough pieces for weekly rubish pick up. Still had plenty of batter left to go. Definitely some vibration, but hands downs beat my chain saws for versatility. Don't think I'll be needing a chain saw much with this.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: There was no battery charger incluided
customer_reviews.text: The weather is getting nicer around here and my wife just opened this present. She thought she would be able to use it. What a horrible surprise. I am very disappointed that we paid this much for something that can't work with out another purchase. Your add should state this. As I am not a tool person I don't know how I would have known if it isn't explicitly stated in the blurb under the picture. Shame on you! I have wasted my money. I hate that. Please contact me - handschuhlarry@gmail.com I sure hope you do.
customer_reviews.author: LAR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DealExactly as Advertised Best Price Available Anywhere 5-Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Deal - Exactly as Advertised - Best Price Available Anywhere - 5-Stars! I have ordered almost every 20V cordless product that Black + decker makes along with 4 batteries and a heavy duty charger to serve all the tools. These replaced all of my older 12V DeWalts that I have previously used for years now. The 12V products just became too heavy to drag around and the batteries quit holding a charge. These new B+D 20Vtools are light years ahead as far as power, ease-in-handling, and hold a charge for a very long time. I would definitely recommend all of the Black+Decker 20V Max cordless power tools to my family & friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cbil

customer_reviews.title: Great for our light duty use
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating this 5 stars based on price and our use. There is no pretense this is equivalent to a Makita, Milwaukee, or Dewalt. We use this around home for trimming larger trunks of shrubs, small tree limbs, a few roots, and occasional shop use. We have several other light duty Black & Decker cordless tools so have a few batteries. This tool is much more convenient than our corded Makita and since purchasing it a few months ago I don't recall using the Makita once. In a few instances we have used this instead of a small chain saw. For us it is a very convenient tool at quite modest cost.
customer_reviews.author: BillAcorn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Knowing the limitations of the technology (i.e. battery pack), and working within those limitations, it has performed up to par. Mostly smaller limbs, a few small pine trees, some pallet dismantling etc. Get good quality blades, and use the correct blades for what you are cutting. I have 2 of the B&D battery packs so I haven't run into a situation where I still needed to cut, but both packs were depleted. YMMV. For some the vibration may seem excessive, but consider the weight (or lack thereof). A better quality corded or portable one weighs more, so a certain amount of vibration is absorbed within the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Be warned, known defective sawzall.
customer_reviews.text: Poor purchase. Not recommended. Variable speed triger switch failed after one use of about four minutes of intermittent use pruning branches. When it did work it was a fine tool that performed as expected. Now that the switch failed I learn that no replacement switches are available. I feel that the company, Amazon or whoever, dumped a defective tool on an unsuspecting market to clear their inventory of a known obsolete or defective product. I would have been OK if a replacement part had been obtainable. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Useful Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of months ago along with a B&D battery circular saw (both without batteries and chargerrs) to help with remodeling our house. They both work great. Several years ago, I bought a B&D weeder and a B&D blower and each came with a battery and charger. I really like that all four tools use the same battery and I can change in and out as needed. Battery life isn't an issue for me (especially having two batteries available) but it could be for heavy, continuous use. I recommend both the reciprocating and circular saw for the home user.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Layman tool user, works well for pruning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hopefully speed up the process of chopping up large pruned branches. It did that. I prefer the precision of this over a chain saw, so I've started using this to prune the lower branches, I still need to use the pole chain saw on higher branches, but now I cringe with the lower precision cuts. This is my first reciprocating saw, I chose this model because I have other black and decker tools with the same battery. I'm thankful the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: MRK

customer_reviews.title: Good saw if used for it purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I already had a charger and three batteries. I needed something to trim numerous evergreen trees scattered throughout my 10 acres. I found any branch 4" in diameter or less was no match for this saws -all. Make sure you pickup some blades with this as it only comes with one. Very good deal on this little monster. It does run through batteries fast if your giving it a good continuous workout. Just buy the darn thing.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Hiner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Pruning Saw for a Senior Grandmother
customer_reviews.text: I bought this great cordless tool to trim branches that are too big for me to cut by hand or with clippers, especially with arthritis in my hands. I bought pruning blades at the local big box store. The saw works great for my pruning jobs and is not too heavy for me to hold. I am careful to use the safety switch when setting it down between cuts. Having it cordless makes it easy to maneuver in small spaces. Note that it does not come with a battery, but the battery from my B&D patio sweeper works on this tool, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dogwood 43

customer_reviews.title: Works Well but Vibration is Harsh
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent saw. Cuts thru anything. But the vibration is so extreme that my hands were throbbing with pain the day after I first used it. I had to order a pair of vibration-prevention gloves from Amazon in order to continue to use the saw. With the gloves, the saw is terrific. One thing I did not notice when I ordered. There is NO BATTERY INCLUDED, nor a charger. I had to head to Lowes for both those components. That added $100 to the price of the saw but still, it was my fault for not reading the description carefully. Battery lasts 15-20 minutes depending upon how hard I use it.
customer_reviews.author: H.H. Eccluus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle, saws like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small saw to cut down some rogue trees and bushes that were taking over my back yard. I did purchase a larger saw blade at the recommendation of some reviewers. I used a 12" Milwaukee pruning blade. I had great success. This saw was easy to handle. I never felt like it was too much of a saw, but it zipped through the branches and roots with no trouble at all. I thought the battery would last a shorter amount of time and had committed to staying in the yard until the battery ran out, but ended up doing plenty of work without the battery running out.
customer_reviews.author: Kind Stranger

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE! Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with a 7ah battery and got through two 2" roots before it overheated and cut itself off. I'm returning this item and purchasing something of higher quality. If you're using this for minor home projects it might work, if you're trimming hedges or cutting roots spend a little more for something in a bright yellow package.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stewart Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love the saw
customer_reviews.text: As a woman I like having my own tools. This is a handy tool for quick jobs in my 2/3 acre property. It's light weight and easy to use. It's not bulky like our other sawzalls that we use for bigger jobs. I've used it with 4", 6" and 9" blades. Great for trimming in the fall to get ready for winter. No need to pull out the extension cord. The battery bought separately charges quickly. I definitely recommend this for women, men and teenagers. I do suggest having a battery backup. I have 2 extra batteries to make sure I can get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: S. Raney

customer_reviews.title: Oak pallet - no problem!
customer_reviews.text: This reciprocating saw is great! I just used it to cut up oak pallets - with the blade that came with it - and it went like a hot knife through butter. Having the use of only one arm, the size of this saw is perfect, only slight down pressure is needed to make quick, clean cuts. It does take a few cuts to get used to everything but it's well worth it! I have a 2.0 a/h battery and it is just as strong now as it was at the start. I really can't find anything wrong with this saw... just be sure you use the correct blade for what you are cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product as a Sawzal and Limb Trimmer (Landscape tool)
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and blade replacements are inexpensive at Walmart. I have several Black and Decker cordless products that I use on my landscape and this is the last product I bought because the chains came off the cordless chainsaw and the cordless extended limb trimmer which I used very heavily and couldn't finish the job. This product finished the job, cutting the remaining limbs and cutting them down-to-size so I could put them in the green dumpsters for pickup. Note to Black and Decker: If you could put this on a pole for cutting limbs with a longer blade I would love it even more.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Versatile saw
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the older (still working after 15 years) version of this saw because it used NiCad batteries and my last one wouldn't hold a charge any longer. I have several 20v lithium batteries for my other tools. I use this for all kinds of cutting, from pruning trees to cutting pipes, to remodeling demolition work. The one down side is that even with the lithium batteries, it draws the battery down quicker than my drill so make sure you have a spare if you plan to do much work.
customer_reviews.author: Odub

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sawzall!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim all of my Rose of Sharons and lilac trees. It cuts through those like a hot knife through butter! I had two chargers and 3 batteries from other B+D products so I didn't need another one. I ultimately bought another one the very next day for my dad who had come over and used it and was absolutely stunned at how high quality it is. It's lightweight and women can easily handle this tool. I also bought 5 bigger blades that will be arriving today. I wish I had purchased this product earlier before i practically killed myself using a hand saw on those trees.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyMazz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, handy saw
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say these things are useful and versatile. For quick rough cuts this thing is great. While not as powerful as a beefier corded versions this seems plenty of capable for basic duties. Being cordless makes it very convenient. I've used it out in the yard to clear out brush/small trees in a wooded area. For a lighter duty entry level tool you seem to get a lot of bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Esquandolas

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my best purchase so far this summer. I needed to repair/replace parts of an old wooden deck. This tool was perfect for cutting out old parts of the decking and joists. I have the 20v battery with the companion drill driver and between the two tools I could cut out the old decking, use a circular saw to cut new decking, and screw it down with the drill driver. I LOVE these 20v battery tools. They are powerful enough for my needs, fit my smaller hands, are sturdy but not too heavy. The battery charges quickly. Great products!
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Killed my hot tub with just 2 charges and effectively
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I cut up my hot tub because the speed it runs at created minimal dust. Went through everything, pipes, wood, fiberglass, acrylic, and made short work of it with no worry of a cord. Held an awesome charge using my trimmer battery I supplied. I have a lot of other plans for it.... Awesome tool and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for pruning palm trees
customer_reviews.text: Perfect saw to prune pindo palm tree AKA jelly palm. My tree is about 17 years old and it’s going to take several battery charges to complete. One battery got me a quarter of the way up from the base of the tree. Wish I had discovered this saw sooner. I also purchased the porter cable 9in pruning blade which worked very well!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a sawzall, and am glad I went with the B&D 20V. I already have a couple of 20V Max drills, and plenty of batteries, so that helps, too. If you were in construction, you'd probably want something a little heavier duty. But, for a homeowner, this saw performs nicely. I've already cut up a few things, and it goes through them like butter. I can't wait to take down some branches, and there is a wall waiting for demo, too. BTW, I saw some reviewers that had trouble locking the blade in. I had absolutely no problem, the mechanism works fine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: DOESNT COME WITH BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: DIDNT LIKE NOT GETTING A SAW BLADE WITH MY SAW BUT AMAZON SENT ME A WHOLE NOTHER TOOL JUST SO ID GET THE BLADE SO I GOT 2 FOR 1... SCORRREEEESSSSS! BUT OTHER THAN THAT SHE WORKS GOOD HAD TO CHOP THE OLD BATHTUB STINK CAN OFF AND SHE JUST FIRED HER RIGHT OFF. GLAD I WENT THRU AMAZON THEY WANT HALF THE PRICE ALL THE LOCAL TOOL SHACKS WANT FOR THIS GUY
customer_reviews.author: C J B

customer_reviews.title: Light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Used primarily for pruning medium sized branches. More than adequate power for this and easy to maneuver because of size and weight .
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M. Shigeta

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, I have other products of the 20V max series and this help to complete my collection. If you are looking at this product, then you likely have others in the series as this does not come with the battery. This product works great, and anytime I am in the need for a reciprocation saw this is always up to the task. It has plenty of power and I have been able to cut through multiple metal and wood projects without issue. Would highly recommend to any DIYer with other 20V max products.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Pruning Madness ... in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool along with some good Bosch Pruning Blades to trim 1' to 1 1/2" dia Bamboo. Best tool I have found for that annual job. I already had a couple of 20V batteries from other B&D tools in their "system" so it was cheap money buying just the power tool itself. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Many uses, just buy it, you’ll use it more than you thought you would!
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing, I have used this to cut back a crate and myrtle tree, bamboo stalks, and a large heavy piece of old furniture that charities would not pick up from a 3rd story. It was too heavy to carry down 3 flights ourselves so I cut it apart using this saw. The cord free is great for outdoor cuts far from an outlet, however, you need to remember it can run out of power stopping the job unless you have a backup battery.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great!
customer_reviews.text: Handiest tool I ever bought! I use it to cut saplings,that were growing through a chain link fence. Cuts them like butter!
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman who is over 70. I can use this reciprocating saw easily...it works like a charm! The battery lasts long enough to get the job done (I have yet to run it completely out of power). It's a wonderful addition to my collection of tools!
customer_reviews.author: Jean L Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one of these from a friend to cut down some tree branches and decided to get one for myself. The grip is perfect for me and I already had an extra battery from an old Black & Decker drill that bit the dust. It fits this perfectly and I bought some extra blades to tackle a variety of job clearing out bushes and small trees in my back yard. I highly recommend this saw and the purchase price was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: gablovesxena

customer_reviews.title: Good portable reciprocating saw for metal or wood!
customer_reviews.text: Main reason I needed this saw was to cut up an exhaust system. With a metal cutting blade, it was super easy. Then I cut a magnesium water heater anode rod. Seems like a nice portable saw for the price, with good speed and no binding that I've encountered. Go slow to start, then once you get in the groove, go all out! Portable is good!
customer_reviews.author: Bucky Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Bummer!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband for Christmas. For various reason he did not take it out of the box to use it until now, end of August. He loved the way it worked and its versatility until it just stopped half way into the job, about 30 minutes. thinking it was the battery because he just picked up one from our other B&D products he changed to a new battery. Still a no go. With no warranty, service help or return we are stuck. We were looking forward to using our new toy for various products.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my best tool purchases ever. I do a lot of projects, and was amazed at how well this saw works and how long a charge lasts. I trimmed a 75' magnolia tree for hours and never depleted the battery, and this is the same battery it shares with the B&D weed wacker. I was never a B&D fan, but now I am. Excellent value. I probably have 8 hours of project time on this tool with about 1.5 hrs of straight cutting time. I was also able to remove several bushes at ground level in less than a minute each. I've saved about 40 man-hours compared to a manual tree saw.
customer_reviews.author: MMA

customer_reviews.title: Sawzall lite duty
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far, so I can see this coming in handy! Put this to use Sunday and the tool over heated and quit working!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Mabry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Capable, light duty, battery recip saw
customer_reviews.text: I own a variety of B&D 20volt tools and think they are all excellent values for a basic homeowner/DIYer. Freedom from 'the cord' is really a huge deal if you are working on ladders of at some distance from a plug. Battery life seems more than adequate for how I would intend to use a light duty tool. If you make your living with a recip saw, I'd probably shoot a little higher than B&D.
customer_reviews.author: Rock of Ages

customer_reviews.title: Strong saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is so versatile. It is strong enough for some light tree trimming. Saves a lot of arm and shoulder strain.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works well for some jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut plastic control valves apart, also PVC fittings in lawn sprinkler repair. Does well with plastic. I try to cut out tree roots with it and not so good. The battery gets warm and shuts down. It will go through 3 inch roots or limbs but that is about it.
customer_reviews.author: ShastaMike

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great handy saw. Keep on work bench from sawing limbs. Don't know why I didn't get this sooner. Great for cutting roots. If you have other tools and batteries then this would be a nice fit. I also bought the tiller, hedge trimmer, pole saw, extened hedge trimmer and drill ( must be 15 yrs old). Never had a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine for a cheapie
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect Dewalt at this price but for those chores away from a power supply its just fine. I've got 5 different B&D battery tools so this just joins the fleet. None of them work as good as their expensive competition but they all do the job without repairs and too me thats good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Quil 1964

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Note there is no battery included, but if you already have Black & Decker batteries in hand - this is perfect. Good price. Easy to use. Does the job. Not heavy. I used it to break down some huge branches that fell because of high winds and to cut off palm leaves that block our pathway.
customer_reviews.author: Addy G.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: I have invested in many of the BD 20V tools for the workshop and yardwork. I didn't own a reciprocating saw and purchased this when I started a bathroom remodel. I found it to be very powerful for cutting through 2x4's nails, plywood, etc. The tool-less blade change works very well. It feels nice in your hands - just the right weight and comfortable grip and texture. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: GEM

customer_reviews.title: Great light duty tool for a do it yourselfer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light duty recip saw that used the B&D 20v battery. It is a great choice for someone who occasionally needs this type of saw but does not want to spend a lof of money. I particularly like the one lever system to change blades. I have several of the B&D tools that use the same battery and have a good report on all of them
customer_reviews.author: NY0J

customer_reviews.title: Reiprocating Saw That Meets All My Demands
customer_reviews.text: I always said you can't go wrong with Black and Decker but they have outdone themselves with their battery units. I needed a saw to cut surface roots away from my lawn. I tried my chain saw but the chain dulled way too quick. I ordered this just for roots but it is so versatile I've used it on repairs etc. Thank you B & D. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Good cutter.  Battery life leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little product. When you need a few quick cuts, it comes through. Just don’t expect more than 10 to 15 minutes of use with these batteries. If you need more, go with a plugged in saw.
customer_reviews.author: D. D.

customer_reviews.title: Another useful addition to my 20v stable of tools
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to order, using "one-click", easy, accurate tracking and prompt delivery. Arrived in new, unopened condition. Was easy to install the blade and worked perfectly for the single job I had planned. Looking forward to using it on other projects that will come up. Makes a useful addition to the collection of 20v lithium tools I'm acquiring. Lithium battery is perfect for the occasional job that confronts the average homeowner. Just charge it after use and it remains fully charged for months.....not to mention the interchangeable feature.
customer_reviews.author: ets

customer_reviews.title: Great Cordless Saw
customer_reviews.text: B&D's recipro saw is well designed and has power comparable to that of a plug in. Using a longer pruning blade than the shorter one it comes with, I cut 5" tree limbs with no issues. It's light and can cut full strength for roughly 15-20 minutes before the battery noticeably draws down. Only drawback is that vibration is very strong so after 15 mins. of cutting, hands/wrists will get tired. All in all, happy with this great tool.
customer_reviews.author: us1

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly..
customer_reviews.text: Used the saw to build plywood tree stand on private property. Cut windows, cut boards to length... could not believe how long the batteries will last...I have two batteries that I rotate as well as a drill that accepts 20V. Also bought a masonry saw, used it to saw existing tile flush with wall before installing baseboard... Light weight makes it well worth the price..... Well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: cut through some 12mm 10.6 bolts and 1" thick aluminum
customer_reviews.text: If you let the blade do the cutting then it won't shut off until the battery is dead. If you apply pressure then the battery will overheat after a little while and shut off until it cools. This actually saves the tool from burning up. Using a 1.5ah battery, I got between 5 and 10 minutes of continual use per charge.
customer_reviews.author: AGS

customer_reviews.title: Good reciprocating saw.
customer_reviews.text: Good reciprocating saw. However the lithium battery life is really short. The batteries also take many hours to charge. Depending on the type of word a battery might last around 15 to 20 minutes. If you have a big job, thisnis not the tool for you. If you need to make a few cuts, this will do just fine. Relatively light weight for a reciprocating saw.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Saw is a bit short...
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's good, saving my energy. The attached saw is a bit short for cutting the yard's tree branches so you have to hold the machine firmly otherwise it may slip from the branch you want to cut. Four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lifan

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long?
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Took down a bunch of smaller growth on our wooded property today right after receiving it. Made much shorter work of jobs I normally do with a large lopper or small (aggressive) saw. Took down a good eight or so smallish (3" or under in diameter) trees and a few unsightly stumps without the battery running out. If this tool lasts a few years it will pay for itself many times over. FWIW, I used the highly recommended Skil Pruning blade (purchased here on amazon) rather than the OEM blade that came with the unit. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Blues

customer_reviews.title: Good for yardwork
customer_reviews.text: Good for trimming small limbs and such, and also cuts through metal. Recommend getting a variety of blades as an accessory. Like any reciprocating saw, you need to hold on tight and don’t count on any precise cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it uses the same battery as my other B&D tools. Very pleased with it. Nice features. I'm especially impressed with the ease of changing the blade! I don't need this saw all that often, but when I do, it sure works well.
customer_reviews.author: Old_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this and so far it seems pretty sturdy and does a good job. I'll check back in after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Von Bose

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to the 20V Collection!
customer_reviews.text: Just added this saw to my Arsenal of 20V BD garden and home improvement tool collection which now numbers four. I also have two others in the 18V series. Like the others, the reciprocating saw has met my expectations. Lightweight and powerful! It may not be professional grade, but for this weekend user, it more than meets my needs!
customer_reviews.author: F. Pono

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cordless saw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cordless saw. It is great not having to navigate around the cord or bother with an extension cord. I have yet to run out of battery power while working on a project. Have used it primarily for trimming trees. It has easily handled trunks and limbs up to 4 inches in diameter. Much better than the hand saw I have been using.
customer_reviews.author: RDL

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: if you have the 20v 4.0 battery already then this saw for 42? is great! small and compact. im using a good 9" pruning blade and it cuts thru 6" branches like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: versatile. impressive. Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: powerful. versatile saw. For pruning trees I like to use the matrix reciprocating saw attachment. The matrix attachment is lighter and better one hand use ergonomics which lends itself to ladder climbing and general pruning. But for heavy duty work like busting pallets up this is a must as the Matrix reciprocating saw attachment is more for light duty and pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Total an dutter Junk
customer_reviews.text: The vibration is BADDDDDD! it also burnt out and failed the second time i used it. Its obviously intended for very light and very occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed. I used this to tear out old boards on my house and it did a great job. My father in law brought his dewalt and this bad boy did as good of a job. Best thing is all my B&D 20 volt lithium batteries work on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected for a battery powered device for some reason I thought this thing was going to not really keep up with the corded one that I already had but it really kicks butt I'm very happy with it.. haven't had it long so we'll see how it holds up after time
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package as soon as I got it and got started working with the tool right away. I love the size. It cut all the limbs and small trees that I wanted to. I already had batteries that fit this tool and one battery lasted for over two hours. I am so glad not to be tethered by power cords.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Short battery
customer_reviews.text: A fine saw, but battery runs out very fast. Cut well. Fine for DIY people. A cheap saw. Get what you pay for. Still a fine saw for $40. Not contractor grade but I cut my stump out with embedded chain in the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: one of the best investments i have ever made
customer_reviews.text: i bought one of these 6 months ago and it stopped working. BUT..I wore it out, after cutting down 40 to 50 trees and thousands of limbs. It was one of the best tool i have ever bought. I bought a second one instead of trying to get a replacement, as in all fairness it did great and performed great. P.S. if you get these black and decker 20v max tools, get the fast charger for the batteries, it will be well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: One tough tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for about 6 weeks and I am very impressed with is capabilities. I'm still using the blade that came with it and it is tough. I have been using the reciprocating saw hard by cutting junk trees from fences, trimmed out lilac bushes and also cut regular lumber. The battery life is also good. It is now my favorite tool and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Mapson

customer_reviews.title: . Please send me my battery.
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows a battery but no battery comes with it. WHY??? MY PROJECT WAS PLACED ON HOLD WHEN WE DISCOVERED NO BATTERY CAME WITH THIS BATTERY OPERATED SAW. WHY? Just charge us but include the battery , please.
customer_reviews.author: V.Will

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good saw for the price. Mostly for cutting branches off trees (or pipes with the right blade) but I used it to cut a few inches off the bottom of a 10-legged table. Lotsa power. Reasonably accurate and stable. Blade has a bit of play in it when installed properly. Apparently that’s normal. I’d recommend this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Baron

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3-4 uses
customer_reviews.text: I had this saw for a year and a half, used maybe 4 times for very light household tasks. Today when I went to use it, it will not turn on. Multiple users tried, multiple charged battery packs that work in other B&D tools did not in this. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: l.s.

customer_reviews.title: Tough saw! Nice size, lightweight and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Tough saw! Nice size, and powerful. I use it for yard stuff and it worked great clearing out a huge 20yr old Algerian Ivy that was taking over our patio. From 4" branches to troublesome roots, it is easy to use with one hand and one of the most useful tools I own. Your chainsaw might get cobwebs as this little guy can do a lot. Good battery life too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Mine refuses to die , now I'm attached.
customer_reviews.text: I work in wastewater . I purchased this product for like 25-30$ . I have now completed well over.100 nasty wet jobs with it . It still works. I bought it to.keep my.nice tools clean and if it fell into a sewage tank I would just replace no biggy. I'm still using it though!! Batteries are like 10$ for it, it's comical. But it works .
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with faulty switch
customer_reviews.text: Received so I would have one when the time came up. When I went to use it the switch malfunctioned. SUre wish I would have discovered that when I first received it. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: B. Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the occasional user, which is almost all of us.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the occasional user. I am just a regular homeowner so I don't use this often, but when I need it, it's great. Like, when I have to cut through a nail in order to extract an electrical box I'm replacing, or making quick cuts to the new gate they installed (poorly) on my wood fence. When you need it, it's great to have. This one is small and cheap and I already have a bunch of these Black and Decker batteries from their other products. I recommend it (or something like it)
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I have had purchased other B&D 20v tools in the past few months and this one was as easy as the other ones to setup and operate. Installing the blade is simple and secures it the way it is engineered. Safety for the variable cutting trigger and I had a job done quickly in cutting off old branches from a dead bush. Easy and clean and put it in storage until next time I need it. Great little saw.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Snavely

customer_reviews.title: check the small print as to what is included
customer_reviews.text: Stupid me did not notice that it foes not come with a battery or charger. Fortunately I have another black and decker product with batter and charger that will work for this saw
customer_reviews.author: Christine C. Goodson

customer_reviews.title: Goos budget saw
customer_reviews.text: We used this as a cheap option to cut down brush in our yard. It did the job without breaking or burning out. It probably won't last forever, but it was a good solution on a budget
customer_reviews.author: ALG953

customer_reviews.title: Have batteries on hand
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why it took me so long to order this. It slices though 8020 aluminum like butter. A 4" maple slab took a little longer and 3 batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R.

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker BDCR20B reciprocal saw
customer_reviews.text: I have only tried this briefly to be sure it was working properly. Purchased it to prune some crepe myrtle trees in the fall. Easy to put together, fairly light, cut the tree limb easily, would recommend it. I also bought some longer blades. I already had the battery and charger so this worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: BevMore

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool quite a bit. I chose to purchase better blades, but the tool is great. Cuts pretty much anything you can imagine working on. One negative I’ve discovered is it shuts down when running a long time (3-5 minutes straight), must be overheat protection. But I’d buy it again for the price, if put in that position again. It’s super handy.
customer_reviews.author: It's Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Very weak saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this electric saw and try to cut a piece of wood. This piece is an only half inch. It is very hard to cut. I don't like it a lot. After that, I purchased a mini circular saw to replace it. The mini circular saw is much easier to use and cut this half inch wood within 5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Tree pruning made easy
customer_reviews.text: Since I already had some B&D cordless tools & batteries, I got this saw to prune some trees and cut small logs (up to 5" diameter). So far it has been perfect, with plenty of power to make the job an easy one! Just make sure you use an appropriate blade type for the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Knight Owl

customer_reviews.title: 2  Stars
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for 1/3 price of Dewalt brand. But you don't expect that performance level of Dewalt. 1. B&D does't specify the SPM (strobe per minute), Dewalt specify 3000 SPM. This number is important to how fast it cuts. 2. B&D's strobe length is 7/8 in while Dewalt one has 1-1/8 in strobe length. This number is important in how fast and efficient it makes a cut. 3. The blade clamp mechanism broke on me after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chuong Le

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut thick branches. It works great and its battery last long. In some cases it shakes, which is annoying. I am not sure if it is all reciprocating saws shake or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amir S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw to cut a hole in wood paneling and through several 2”x3” wood wall studs. The saw worked great. For small jobs, I am pleased with the price of the unit and what it can do on 20v.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice accessory to use with B&D's 20 V battery packs (remember battery not included).
customer_reviews.text: New condition priced right. B&D's 20 V battery system (remember no battery in the package) makes this a nice home and garden accessory to have and I appreciate the standardized interchangeability between my trimmers and other helpful accessories. Very nice. Original packaging and appears to be new (even though I purchased as a refurb).
customer_reviews.author: Scalewoodman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home
customer_reviews.text: It's black and Decker,vso don't expect to use it as a professional. I use it around the house and so far it is great for light/medium duty cutting. Lightweight and easy blade replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: It's a breeze and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's already paid for itself I've used it for things and it's wonderful and really easy to use for anything and truly will cut anything I tried to cut it's truly with the price
customer_reviews.author: Eric Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw and blades.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a battery Sawzall and did not want to spend a lot of money so far all is working well, got the blades too I am ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Vignali

customer_reviews.title: powerfull
customer_reviews.text: goes through pieces of wood like it's butter. it works quite well, I like it for a small apartment necessities.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Small but functional.
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. Gets in hard to reach places. It hasn't failed me yet but it's not the strongs sawzall I've used. For the price I didn't expect much but it cut everything I've ran into so far with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Kailey G.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this little saw provides excellent cutting power with surprising battery life. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Had to trim the gate that was connected to our fence. It never shut quite right and didn't latch at all. This device worked great, the battery did start to die when I was close to being done but I had another one in waiting to swap in. The only thing I would suggest is a longer blade, but other than that it performed perfectly and seriously the price is phenomenal. I have another Black + Decker Impact drill that these go well together.
customer_reviews.author: localbrew

customer_reviews.title: best 28 bucks i ever spent
customer_reviews.text: best 28 bucks i ever spent. Huge fan of black and decker products and this saw is no different. It works flawlessly. I managed to cut off about 50 dead limbs from trees in my yard with ease and less than a full battery. couldnt be happier. Black and deckers customer service is unmatched and ill be a proud customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: N. J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed for removing overgrown hedge with thick stems and it worked flawlessly with long battery life. I think it will be fine for smaller trimming jobs like mine with stem thickness over 2" but it is not a chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: T. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quick Jobs
customer_reviews.text: This works great for small projects. However, you need to use for more than 10 minutes, buy a corded one. This works for me as I only need to use here and there. Works great for light to moderate quick projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Reciprocating Saw, Tool Only (BDCR20B)
product_meta.description: Style:Reciprocating SawThe BLACK+DECKER BDCR20B 20v MAX Lithium Bare Reciprocating Saw features tool-free blade changing. It also has a variable speed trigger and a pivoting shoe for ease of use. The maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts. Nominal voltage is 18 volts. This recap saw offers 0-3,000 strokes/minute and a stroke length of 7/8". This is a bare-tool item - battery sold separately (not included). Standard equipment included: (1) BDCR20 20v Max Lithium Reciprocating Saw and (1) Reciprocating Blade.The tool is equipped with a switch lock-off feature to prevent unintentional operation.To switch the tool on, press the lock off button. then squeeze the on/off switch. Releasing the trigger turns the motor OFF. This tool has no provision to lock the switch in the ON position, never be locked in the ON position by any and should other means. Troubleshoot-unit shuts off abruptly. Battery pack has reached its maximum thermal limit. Allow battery pack to cool down. Battery pack will not charge Surrounding air temperature too hot or too cold. Move charger and battery pack to a surrounding air temperature of above 40 degree fahrenheit or below 105 degree fahrenheit Included Components: BDCR20 20V MAX* Lithium Reciprocating Saw, (1) Reciprocating Saw Blade; Stroke Length: 7/8 in. Keyless Blade Clamp - Yes
feature_bullets: Tool Free Blade Change; Battery and charger sold separately
Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 20 volts; Nominal voltage is 18.
Includes: BDCR20 20V MAX Lithium Reciprocating Sawand 1 Reciprocating Saw Blade
Maximum initial battery voltage is 20 volts
